data.event: The town is named after King George III, who reigned at the time the island was claimed for Britain and garrisoned by the Admiralty in 1815.
A naval base was established at Georgetown in 1816 due to British concerns that the French might make use of the island to attempt a rescue of their exiled former Emperor.
Following Napoleon's death in 1821, the settlement found a new role as a supply, maintenance and victualling base for the West Africa Squadron.

event.title: 1829 a small jetty had been constructed

data.event: By 1829 a small jetty had been constructed as well as several buildings on what is now the Regent Square area, close to the sea (including a hospital - the West Africa Squadron was notoriously prone to sickness).
